diagnosed.name: Correct coding of CKD diagnosis
diagnosed.description:
Description: Patients with correct coding of CKD (Stage 3 or above) based on eGFR and ACR readings as specified in NICE guidance.
Eligible patients: patients with a CKD diagnostic code (stage 3 or above) or eGFR readings persistently < 60 ml/min/1.73m2 who do not have a QOF exclusion code.
Correct patients: patients who have a diagnostic code matching their latest eGFR and/or ACR readings.
diagnosed.tagline: of your patients with a CKD stage 3 or above based on their latest eGFR and ACR readings have the correct diagnosis coded in their record according to NICE guidelines
diagnosed.positiveMessage: There's lots of room for improvement - but don't be disheartened! Look through the suggestions listed on this page and under each patient for improvement actions to take.

wrongStage.name: wrongStage
wrongStage.description: Patients who have CKD stage 3 or above according to their latest eGFR and ACR readings but who do not have a CKD diagnosis code in their record

overdiagnosed.name: Overdiagnosed
overdiagnosed.description: Patients who have a CKD diagnostic code in their record but their latest eGFR readings do not meet the criteria for CKD diagnosis stage 3 or above

suggestExclude.name: Suggest Exclude
suggestExclude.description: Patients who have a CKD stage 3 or above diagnosis code in their record or who have CKD stage 3 or above based on their latest eGFR readings and who may benefit from being excluded from CKD quality indicators

AcrTest.name: AcrTest
AcrTest.description: Patients who have CKD stage 3 or above according to their latest eGFR and ACR readings but who have the wrong CKD diagnosis code in their record

rightStageWrongSubstage.name: rightStageWrongSubstage
rightStageWrongSubstage.description: Patients who have CKD stage 3 or above according to their latest eGFR reading and have a CKD diagnosis code in their record but no ACR reading to correctly stage their CKD

acrTest.description: Patients who have CKD stage 3 or above according to their latest eGFR and ACR readings but who do not have a CKD diagnosis code in their record

addCode.name: addCode
addCode.description: Patients who have a CKD diagnostic code in their record but their latest eGFR readings do not meet the criteria for CKD diagnosis stage 3 or above
